column4: Basically, I am using a Ubuntu 6.06 CD; I always occasionally use ubuntu's Live-CD but always go back to windows, not the NTLDR doesn't work. I want to copy an image to my floppydisk and well... its not letting me. I tried that dd if=<image> of=<function>, but it doesnt work at all. It says the floppy disk is locked, and i can't mount any NTFS drives in hope of replacing those damaged files..
btw i am a uber-linux noob ._.
i dont even want to touch partitions right now, i have too much valuable info on the HD for something to go wrong
i've had bad expriences with attempting to parition my drive :-/
if i could only mount the main NTFS drive, i can simply replace the files; i have the files ready
quick question, why cant Ubuntu mount NTFS drives; i've tried other linux distro and a few can. Ubuntu seems to me one of the most user-friendly
this would all be so simple if it could -_-
It says the disk is locked?? Is it mounted or something ? Oh hang on there is a write protect tab on a floppy. Check that?
'It's not letting me' is not enough info. The exactly failure is needed.
Unmount it. dd writes directly to the block device, not to the filesystem
Right, now you should be able to dd to the block device
thanks alot... why couldnt that be that easy in the beginning? xD
